intro: Antiaris humbertii, commonly known as the African elephant tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive, branched trunk. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange to red berries. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally in some regions for their medicinal properties. Antiaris humbertii is also valued for its ornamental appearance and ecological role in its native habitat.
